name: Multiplayer Snake Game Workflow
description: Create a networked Snake game for up to 4 players using CLI tools.
prompt: Develop a multiplayer Snake game playable over a network for up to 4 players with real-time interaction.

steps.title: Setup Project Structure
steps.prompt: Create a new project directory for a multiplayer Snake game. Initialize it with necessary folders for source code, assets, and configuration files. Use a suitable programming language or framework for CLI-based networked games (e.g., Python with sockets or Node.js).
steps.verify_prompt: Check if the project directory and initial files are created correctly. Output <promise>PASS</promise> if the structure is set up.

steps.title: Implement Core Snake Game Logic
steps.prompt: Write the core logic for a single-player Snake game, including snake movement, food spawning, collision detection, and game over conditions. Ensure the game runs in a terminal/console environment.
steps.verify_prompt: Test the single-player Snake game in the terminal to ensure movement, food collection, and collision detection work as expected. Output <promise>PASS</promise> if the game functions correctly.

steps.title: Add Network Support for Multiplayer
steps.prompt: Integrate network functionality using sockets or a similar technology to support up to 4 players. Implement a server to handle player connections and a client to connect to the server. Ensure real-time updates for snake positions and game state.
steps.verify_prompt: Test the network setup by connecting multiple clients (up to 4) to the server. Verify that player movements are synchronized across clients. Output <promise>PASS</promise> if multiplayer works.

steps.title: Handle Player Identification and Scoring
steps.prompt: Add logic to identify each player uniquely (e.g., by color or name) and maintain individual scores. Display scores in the game interface for all connected players.
steps.verify_prompt: Test the game with multiple players to ensure each player is uniquely identified and scores are updated and displayed correctly. Output <promise>PASS</promise> if scoring works.

steps.title: Implement Game Over and Restart Logic
steps.prompt: Add multiplayer-specific game over conditions (e.g., last player standing wins) and provide an option to restart the game without disconnecting. Ensure all clients are notified of game over and restart events.
steps.verify_prompt: Test the game over and restart functionality with multiple players. Confirm that all clients receive game over notifications and can restart seamlessly. Output <promise>PASS</promise> if this works.

steps.title: Polish and Document
steps.prompt: Add final touches like clear terminal output formatting, instructions for running the server and client, and error handling for network issues. Write a README with setup and gameplay instructions.
steps.verify_prompt: Review the game for user experience in the terminal and check the README for clarity. Output <promise>PASS</promise> if the game is polished and documentation is complete.
